page.title: 16Dykes Of Dymchurch
page.content: The dykes were built to protect Romney Marsh from over-flooding.The dykes are a part of the marsh landscape.The main dykes lead out to the sluices.There are 2 sluices in Dymchurch the Willop & the Marshland.The Willop is also a pumping station.The water is drained in the Winter & left in the Summer.The 3 months when water is most valued are June,July & August,when it can be pumped back in to the fields through tile-drains.The highest the water has been in the Marshland Basin is 5m.Weed causing blockage is a problem.The Water Board keep it down by use of aerial-spray,tractor-spraying & chopp- ing by hand.They have experimented with Chinese Carp,a weed-eating fish, but they don't breed in England.The dykes are also dredged every 10 years. The average depth of the dykes is 6 ft.
